intro: Thelypodium lasiophyllum var. utahense, commonly known as Utah thelypodium, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped with a distinctive bluish-green color and a hairy texture. This variety is often found in rocky or gravelly soils in arid and semi-arid environments.
